channel.title: Fixeds on Raúl Negrón's Website
channel.description: Recent content in Fixeds on Raúl Negrón's Website

item.title: About Me
item.description: At Ginzan Onsen I was born February 5th, 1995. I got my bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from the University of Puerto Rico at Río Piedras in early 2018. Apart from computer science and math, I enjoy studying philosophy and different languages. If you’re interested in my resume, you can obtain it here.

item.title: Reading List
item.description: Here are some of the more technical books I’ve read recently. Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software, by Charles Petzold An Introduction to Functional Programming Through Lambda Calculus, by Greg Michaelson Data Science from Scratch: First Principles with Python, by Joel Grus Don’t Make Me Think, Revisited: A Common Sense Approach to Web Usability, by Steve Krug HTML and CSS: Design and Build Websites, by Jon Duckett And some miscellaneous books I’ve managed to sneak in.
